conclusion: The graph shows a symmetric v-t (velocity-time) graph.
The graph is symmetric about the dashed line.
The velocity decreases from a positive value to zero before the dashed line.
The velocity increases from zero to the same positive value after the dashed line.
The area under the curve from 0 to the dashed line is equal to the area from the dashed line to t1.
The particle travels the same distance in both halves of the interval but in opposite directions.
The particle starts with a positive velocity and slows down to zero.
The particle momentarily stops at the dashed line.
The particle accelerates back to the initial positive velocity.
The particle moves backward, retracing its path.
The particle passes through a certain position three times.
The particle crosses the starting point (initial position) once while moving forward, once while stopping, and once while moving backward.
The particle passes through the initial position three times within the time interval from 0 to t1.
The particle passes through the initial position three times within the time interval from 0 to t1.
